intro: Canthium urophyllum, commonly known as the redseed sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Canthium urophyllum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
